events.title: First Aliyah
events.description: The first major wave of Jewish immigration to Palestine begins, marking the start of modern Zionist settlement.

events.title: First Zionist Congress
events.description: Theodor Herzl convenes the First Zionist Congress in Basel, Switzerland, establishing the World Zionist Organization.

events.title: Balfour Declaration
events.description: Britain issues the Balfour Declaration, expressing support for a 'national home for the Jewish people' in Palestine.

events.title: British Mandate Begins
events.description: The League of Nations grants Britain the mandate to govern Palestine, following the collapse of the Ottoman Empire.

events.title: Hebron Massacre
events.description: Arab riots in Hebron result in the deaths of 67 Jews, leading to the evacuation of the Jewish community there.

events.title: Hitler Comes to Power
events.description: Adolf Hitler becomes Chancellor of Germany, leading to increased Jewish immigration to Palestine.

events.title: Arab Revolt Begins
events.description: A three-year Arab uprising against British rule and Jewish immigration begins in Palestine.

events.title: White Paper
events.description: Britain issues the White Paper, severely restricting Jewish immigration to Palestine at a critical time.

events.title: Biltmore Program
events.description: Zionist leaders adopt the Biltmore Program, calling for a Jewish state in Palestine after World War II.

events.title: End of World War II
events.description: The Holocaust ends, revealing the full extent of the genocide and strengthening the case for a Jewish state.

events.title: UN Partition Plan
events.description: The United Nations votes to partition Palestine into separate Jewish and Arab states.

events.title: Declaration of Independence
events.description: David Ben-Gurion declares the establishment of the State of Israel on May 14, 1948.

events.title: War of Independence
events.description: Israel fights for survival against invading Arab armies from Egypt, Syria, Jordan, Lebanon, and Iraq.

events.title: Armistice Agreements
events.description: Israel signs armistice agreements with Egypt, Lebanon, Jordan, and Syria, ending the War of Independence.

events.title: Suez Crisis
events.description: Israel, along with Britain and France, invades Egypt's Sinai Peninsula in response to the nationalization of the Suez Canal.

events.title: Eichmann Captured
events.description: Nazi war criminal Adolf Eichmann is captured in Argentina by Israeli agents and brought to trial in Israel.

events.title: Six-Day War
events.description: Israel wins a decisive victory in six days, gaining control of the West Bank, Gaza Strip, Sinai Peninsula, and Golan Heights.

events.title: Yom Kippur War
events.description: Egypt and Syria launch a surprise attack on Yom Kippur, the holiest day in Judaism, beginning the October War.

events.title: Menachem Begin Elected
events.description: Menachem Begin becomes Prime Minister, ending 29 years of Labor Party dominance and beginning the Likud era.

events.title: Camp David Accords
events.description: Israel and Egypt sign the Camp David Accords, leading to a peace treaty and the return of the Sinai Peninsula to Egypt.

events.title: Peace Treaty with Egypt
events.description: Israel and Egypt sign a formal peace treaty, making Egypt the first Arab country to recognize Israel.

events.title: First Lebanon War
events.description: Israel invades Lebanon to remove PLO forces, leading to a prolonged military presence in southern Lebanon.

events.title: First Intifada Begins
events.description: Palestinian uprising begins in the West Bank and Gaza Strip, marked by widespread protests and civil disobedience.

events.title: Gulf War
events.description: Iraq fires Scud missiles at Israel during the Gulf War, but Israel does not retaliate at the request of the United States.

events.title: Madrid Conference
events.description: The Madrid Peace Conference brings together Israel, Arab states, and Palestinians for direct negotiations.

events.title: Oslo Accords
events.description: Israel and the PLO sign the Oslo Accords, establishing the Palestinian Authority and beginning the peace process.

events.title: Peace Treaty with Jordan
events.description: Israel and Jordan sign a peace treaty, making Jordan the second Arab country to recognize Israel.

events.title: Rabin Assassinated
events.description: Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin is assassinated by a Jewish extremist opposed to the peace process.

events.title: Second Intifada Begins
events.description: The Al-Aqsa Intifada begins after Ariel Sharon visits the Temple Mount, leading to years of violence.

events.title: Gaza Disengagement
events.description: Israel unilaterally withdraws all settlements and military forces from the Gaza Strip.

events.title: Second Lebanon War
events.description: Israel fights a 34-day war with Hezbollah in Lebanon after the group kidnaps Israeli soldiers.

events.title: Operation Cast Lead
events.description: Israel launches a major military operation in Gaza in response to rocket attacks from Hamas.

events.title: Operation Protective Edge
events.description: A 50-day conflict between Israel and Hamas in Gaza, resulting in significant casualties on both sides.

events.title: Abraham Accords
events.description: Israel normalizes relations with the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain, with Morocco and Sudan following later.

events.title: October 7 Attacks
events.description: Hamas launches a surprise attack on Israel, killing over 1,200 people and triggering a major war in Gaza.
